name: Scientific Manuscript Review Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for manuscript review quality

criteria.name: Structure and Organization
criteria.description: How well the review addresses manuscript structure and logical flow

scores.1: No structural analysis; fails to identify organizational issues
scores.2: Superficial structural review; misses major organizational problems
scores.3: Adequate structural review; identifies main issues but lacks depth
scores.4: Thorough structural review; identifies most issues with clear suggestions
scores.5: Comprehensive structural analysis; identifies all issues with specific, actionable fixes

criteria.name: Scientific Rigor Assessment
criteria.description: Quality of evaluation of claims, evidence, and scientific logic

scores.1: No assessment of scientific claims or evidence alignment
scores.2: Superficial claims review; misses major overclaiming or logic gaps
scores.3: Adequate assessment; identifies some claims-evidence issues
scores.4: Good assessment; identifies most claims issues with clear rationale
scores.5: Excellent rigorous assessment; all claims audited with evidence mapping

criteria.name: Language and Clarity Improvements
criteria.description: Quality of language editing and clarity enhancements

scores.1: No language improvements offered; errors remain
scores.2: Minimal editing; misses significant clarity issues
scores.3: Adequate editing; addresses obvious language problems
scores.4: Good editing; improves clarity substantially with appropriate style
scores.5: Excellent editing; polished, clear prose while preserving author voice

criteria.name: Section-Specific Guidance
criteria.description: Quality of advice for Introduction, Results, Discussion sections

scores.2: Generic advice not tailored to manuscript sections
scores.3: Some section-specific guidance but inconsistent across sections
scores.4: Good guidance for most sections with specific improvements
scores.5: Comprehensive guidance for all sections following best practices

criteria.name: Actionability of Feedback
criteria.description: How specific and implementable the suggestions are

scores.1: Vague feedback; author cannot act on it
scores.3: Mix of specific and vague feedback
scores.4: Mostly specific and actionable feedback with clear next steps
scores.5: All feedback specific, actionable, with examples or rewrites provided

criteria.name: Preservation of Author Voice
criteria.description: Whether editing preserves original intent and style

scores.1: Complete rewrite that changes meaning or invents content
scores.2: Significant changes to author's meaning or style
scores.3: Some changes that alter intended meaning
scores.4: Most changes preserve author voice; minor style shifts only
scores.5: All changes preserve author voice and intent; improvements without overwriting

passing_note: Average score must be â‰¥ 3.5 for review to be considered complete. Scores below 3 in 'Scientific Rigor Assessment' or 'Actionability' require revision.
